column4: Why does this settings in httpd.conf file not work to only allow one ip to connect: http://paste.ubuntu.com/563637/
I'm usinf Apache in Ubuntu Server 10.04.
*using
change order to allow,deny
it is reading those instructions as "check address against deny list, then allow list" and the deny list says "all"
I have tried allow,deny but it didn't work either.
No girst it denies all access then it allows one ip.
It doesn't work the other way either.
I don't think the settings is active att all actually. :S
i think i am losing it.. s/Allow 12.345.678.90/Allow from 12.345.678.90
missing "from"
I don't think you need the from when having a single ip. The problem is that the deny rule doesn't work at all. I get full access to the server all the time independent of the deny/allow rule.
Apache doesn't seem to care at all about the settings in the httpd.conf file. :(
I have followed the steps in this guide (look at the bottom of the page): http://www.linux.com/archive/feature/113744
Look at: "Files and directories".
I have done exactly like that but it doesn't work.
The solution of my problem was to edit the avaiable-sites/default file instead of the httpd.conf file. :S The httpd.conf file was not the right file to edit using Debian system.
The allow,deny problem you know.
ahh.. i was looking into htaccess as a solution as well.. live and learn.
thanks for letting me know how it got solved.
Thanks trying to help me out on this.
